intro: Oligoneuron ohioense, commonly known as the Ohio oligoneuron, is a rare flowering plant native to the central United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and wetlands. Its botanical features include finely divided leaves and a distinct, aromatic scent. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several states.
